senses.sense_definition: A surname of Scottish origin, derived from the Scottish Gaelic word for a round hill.

examples.text: Mr. <w>Knox</w> has been teaching history at the college for twenty years.
The <w>Knox</w> family is well-known in this part of Scotland.

senses.sense_definition: A male given name derived from the surname.

examples.text: They decided to name their newborn son <w>Knox</w>.
<w>Knox</w> is playing with his friends in the park.

senses.sense_definition: A name used for various towns, cities, and counties across the United States.

examples.text: We drove through <w>Knox</w> on our road trip across Indiana.
The population of <w>Knox</w> County has increased significantly.

senses.sense_definition: A local government area in the eastern suburbs of Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

examples.text: The City of <w>Knox</w> provides various services to its residents.
She lives in a quiet neighborhood within <w>Knox</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A small, wall-mounted safe holding building keys for emergency services; short for <w>Knox Box</w>.

examples.text: The firefighters opened the <w>Knox</w> to gain quick access to the burning building.
Building codes often require a <w>Knox</w> at the main entrance for safety.
